body:
> [!NOTE] > Currently processing new changes in this PR. This may take a few minutes, please wait... > > > > ```ascii > _______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ > < Always code as if the person who ends up maintaining your code is a violent psychopath who knows where you live. - John Woods > > ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- > \ > \ \ > \ /\ > ( ) > .( o ). > ``` > > ✏️ Tip: You can disable in-progress messages and the fortune message in your review settings.
📝 Walkthrough ## Walkthrough This pull request introduces a comprehensive game engine architecture overhaul, adding a scene management system with hierarchical GameObjects, a component-based architecture for behavior composition, enhanced camera data handling, mouse input support, and graphics API improvements. Build configuration adds code formatting standards and version propagation, while CI/CD workflows are updated for linting and semantic versioning. ## Changes | Cohort / File(s) | Summary | |---|---| | **Configuration & Code Style**
`.clang-format`, `package.json`, `.gitignore` | New LLVM-based clang-format config with Allman braces and 4-space indent; added Node.js manifest for commitlint and semantic-release; extended gitignore for node_modules and build directories | | **CI/CD Workflows**
`.github/workflows/commitlint.yml`, `.github/workflows/lint.yml`, `.github/workflows/release.yml` | Removed commitlint workflow; added comprehensive lint workflow with cpp-linter-action, clang-format, and auto-commit; enhanced release workflow with version computation, npm caching, and version propagation to CMake | | **Build System**
`CMakeLists.txt`, `cmake/GitVersion.cmake` | Added FetchContent for GLM, enabled compile commands export, wrapped OpenGL preference for Apple, updated version header handling; added early-return optimization in GitVersion when CMAKE_PROJECT_VERSION is set | | **Core Engine Subsystem**
`engine/source/Engine.{h,cpp}`, `engine/source/Application.{h,cpp}`, `engine/source/eng.h` | Added scene management (SetScene/GetScene), input callbacks for mouse, camera data computation in render loop, explicit subsystem accessors; marked Init and NeedsToBeClosed with [[nodiscard]]; extended public header exposure for scene components | | **Graphics API & Rendering**
`engine/source/graphics/GraphicsAPI.{h,cpp}`, `engine/source/graphics/ShaderProgram.{h,cpp}` | Added GraphicsAPI::Init() for depth testing, improved const-correctness, updated ClearBuffers to clear both color and depth; added matrix uniform support (SetUniform with glm::mat4), GLM includes, Bind() marked const | | **Mesh & Material System**
`engine/source/render/{Mesh,Material}.{h,cpp}`, `engine/source/graphics/VertexLayout.h` | Constructors now use const references, Bind/Draw marked const, added GetShaderProgram accessor to Material; improved documentation; minor formatting standardization | | **Render Queue & Camera**
`engine/source/render/RenderQueue.{h,cpp}` | RenderCommand now uses shared_ptr for Mesh/Material, added modelMatrix field; new CameraData struct with viewMatrix and projectionMatrix; Draw accepts camera data and sets per-object uniforms | | **Input System**
`engine/source/input/InputManager.{h,cpp}` | Extended with mouse button state tracking (m_mouseKeys array), mouse position tracking (old/current), and corresponding accessor/mutator methods | | **Scene & GameObject Foundation**
`engine/source/scene/{Component,GameObject,Scene}.{h,cpp}` | New base Component class with virtual Update, type identification via StaticTypeId template, and GetOwner accessor; GameObject with hierarchical structure (parent/children), transform (position/rotation/scale), component system, and lifecycle (IsAlive/MarkForDestroy); Scene with object creation, parenting logic, and camera management | | **Component Implementations**
`engine/source/scene/components/{CameraComponent,MeshComponent,PlayerControllerComponent}.{h,cpp}` | CameraComponent computes view/projection matrices with parent transform support; MeshComponent submits RenderCommands to queue; PlayerControllerComponent handles WASD movement and mouse-look controls | | **Application & Game Logic**
`source/{Game,TestObject}.{h,cpp}`, `source/{game.h,main.cpp}` | Refactored game class hierarchy with Application-based Game implementing Init/Update/Destroy; new TestObject demonstrates GameObject/Component usage; updated main.cpp with const references and parameterized window dimensions | | **IDE Configuration**
`.idea/vcs.xml` | Added VCS mapping for GLM dependency directory | ## Sequence Diagrams ```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Engine participant Scene participant GameObject participant Component participant RenderQueue Engine->>Scene: Update(deltaTime) Scene->>GameObject: Update(deltaTime) for each object GameObject->>Component: Update(deltaTime) for each component Component->>RenderQueue: Submit(RenderCommand) Note over Component: MeshComponent builds
RenderCommand with
model matrix Engine->>RenderQueue: Draw(GraphicsAPI, CameraData) RenderQueue->>RenderQueue: Iterate commands Note over RenderQueue: Set uniforms uModel,
uView, uProjection ``` ```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant InputHandler participant Engine participant InputManager participant PlayerController participant GameObject InputHandler->>InputManager: SetMouseButtonPressed(button, true) InputHandler->>InputManager: SetMousePositionCurrent(pos) Engine->>GameObject: Update(deltaTime) GameObject->>PlayerController: Update(deltaTime) PlayerController->>InputManager: IsMouseButtonPressed(LMB) PlayerController->>InputManager: GetMousePositionOld/Current Note over PlayerController: Compute camera rotation
from mouse delta PlayerController->>GameObject: SetRotation(newRotation) Note over PlayerController: Compute forward vector,
apply WASD movement PlayerController->>GameObject: SetPosition(newPosition) ``` ## Estimated code review effort 🎯 4 (Complex) | ⏱️ ~45 minutes ## Poem > 🐰 *A grand architecture born anew,* > *With scenes and components shining through!* > *GameObjects dance with cameras bright,* > *While render queues paint frames each night.* > *The engine transforms, component-wise clear—* > *A leap forward for all who code here!* ✨
🚥 Pre-merge checks | ✅ 1 | ❌ 2
❌ Failed checks (2 warnings) | Check name | Status | Explanation | Resolution | | :----------------: | :--------- | :-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | :------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | | Description check | ⚠️ Warning | The PR description is incomplete: it contains only the template skeleton with checkboxes marked, but provides no actual implementation details or behavioral explanation of the scene management feature. | Complete the description by replacing '[Provide a brief description of the changes]' with actual details about scene management implementation, component system, and major architectural changes introduced. | | Docstring Coverage | ⚠️ Warning | Docstring coverage is 14.05% which is insufficient. The required threshold is 80.00%. | Write docstrings for the functions missing them to satisfy the coverage threshold. |
✅ Passed checks (1 passed) | Check name | Status | Explanation | | :---------: | :------- | :----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | Title check | ✅ Passed | The title 'feat: Scene Management' directly and clearly describes the main feature addition, matching the primary changes across multiple files. |
✏️ Tip: You can configure your own custom pre-merge checks in the settings.
✨ Finishing touches
🧪 Generate unit tests (beta) - [ ] Create PR with unit tests - [ ] Post copyable unit tests in a comment - [ ] Commit unit tests in branch `scene-management`
--- Thanks for using [CodeRabbit](https://coderabbit.ai?utm_source=oss&utm_medium=github&utm_campaign=Bookfan97/Basic-Game-Engine&utm_content=11)! It's free for OSS, and your support helps us grow. If you like it, consider giving us a shout-out.
❤️ Share - [X](https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=I%20just%20used%20%40coderabbitai%20for%20my%20code%20review%2C%20and%20it%27s%20fantastic%21%20It%27s%20free%20for%20OSS%20and%20offers%20a%20free%20trial%20for%20the%20proprietary%20code.%20Check%20it%20out%3A&url=https%3A//coderabbit.ai) - [Mastodon](https://mastodon.social/share?text=I%20just%20used%20%40coderabbitai%20for%20my%20code%20review%2C%20and%20it%27s%20fantastic%21%20It%27s%20free%20for%20OSS%20and%20offers%20a%20free%20trial%20for%20the%20proprietary%20code.%20Check%20it%20out%3A%20https%3A%2F%2Fcoderabbit.ai) - [Reddit](https://www.reddit.com/submit?title=Great%20tool%20for%20code%20review%20-%20CodeRabbit&text=I%20just%20used%20CodeRabbit%20for%20my%20code%20review%2C%20and%20it%27s%20fantastic%21%20It%27s%20free%20for%20OSS%20and%20offers%20a%20free%20trial%20for%20proprietary%20code.%20Check%20it%20out%3A%20https%3A//coderabbit.ai) - [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/sharing/share-offsite/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fcoderabbit.ai&mini=true&title=Great%20tool%20for%20code%20review%20-%20CodeRabbit&summary=I%20just%20used%20CodeRabbit%20for%20my%20code%20review%2C%20and%20it%27s%20fantastic%21%20It%27s%20free%20for%20OSS%20and%20offers%20a%20free%20trial%20for%20proprietary%20code)

performed_via_github_app.name: coderabbitai
performed_via_github_app.description:
# Transforming Code Reviews with AI

## Features

**Automated Reviews**: Continuous reviews of the pull requests including incremental commits. 

**Summarization**: Generates high-level summary and a technical walkthrough of the PR changes. 

**Line-by-line review**: Provides line-by-line suggestions committable with one click.

**Codebase verification**:  Verifies the impact on the overall codebase and identifies missing changes.

**Insights into your code**:  Ask any questions on your codebase within the pull request 

**Chat about your code** : Chat with the bot around your code. The more you chat, the smarter it gets.

**Issue Validation**:  Validates the PR against the linked issues and identifies other related issues
